topic.title: What is your favorite Linux distribution and why?
topic.body: I have been using Linux Mint for something like 7 or  8 years, because it has drivers for nearly everything.  It has worked out of the box on essentially every computer I have tried it on.  My next favorite is Zorin Lite, because it runs well on old, under-powered computers, but I haven't used it in a while.

1_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz.body: I finally found something I like better than Linux Mint.  Parrot OS works as well on my computers as Mint.  It should be more secure.  And, its automatic updates work.  One of the few things I don't like about it is that the touchpad driver causes hesitation when you first begin to move the pointer.
